table.name: active_orchard_spu
table.remarks: It is used to control which orchard can be used in the Seedlot registration process and also to indicate which legacy seed plan unit id should to be used.

column.name: orchard_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier which is assigned to a location where cuttings or A class seed is produced.

column.name: seed_plan_unit_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier which is assigned to a legacy Seed Planning Unit. It is used for historical porpuse and to link data to Oracle database. A -1 indicates that the orchard has no SPU associated with it.

column.name: active_ind
column.remarks: Indicates if the combined orchard and SPU are the ones to be used and are active.

column.name: retired_ind
column.remarks: Indicates retired orchards that should only be used to show legacy information.

column.name: no_spu_ind
column.remarks: Indicates a new orchard that has not a SPU assigned yet.

table.name: cone_collection_method_list
table.remarks: A list of valid Cone based Collection Method Codes.

column.name: cone_collection_method_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Cone Collection Methods.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description for the affiliated code.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The effective date the code is in effect

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the code expires on.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time of the last update.

table.name: etl_execution_log_hist
table.remarks: ETL Tool monitoring table to store all executed instances of batch processing interfaces

column.name: interface_id
column.remarks: Unique interface name to represent a batch execution. Refer to EXECUTION_MAP table PK

column.name: execution_id
column.remarks: The execution ID that represent a batch execution. Refer to EXECUTION_MAP table PK

column.name: execution_status
column.remarks: Status of this execution. FAILED or SUCCESS expected.

column.name: execution_details
column.remarks: Reference text of this interface instance execution

column.name: source_connect_timedelta
column.remarks: Timedelta referring to how much time was needed to stablish a connection in the source database

column.name: source_extract_timedelta
column.remarks: Timedelta referring to how much time was needed to execute a extract statement in the source database

column.name: source_extract_row_count
column.remarks: Number of rows extracted from the source database for this execution.

column.name: target_connect_timedelta
column.remarks: Timedelta referring to how much time was needed to stablish a connection in the target database

column.name: target_load_timedelta
column.remarks: Timedelta referring to how much time was needed to load the extracted data in the target database

column.name: target_load_row_count
column.remarks: Number of rows inserted or updated in the target database for this execution.

column.name: process_started_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when this execution instance was started

column.name: process_finished_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when this execution instance was finished

column.name: process_timedelta
column.remarks: Timedelta referring how much time was spent to execute the whole process.

column.name: last_run_ts
column.remarks: Last timestamp this interface instance was executed for batch execution

column.name: current_run_ts
column.remarks: Current timestamp this interface instance was executed of this batch execution

column.name: retry_process
column.remarks: If true, this log instance will be processed again (with last_run_ts and current_run_ts parameters)

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp of the last time this record was updated

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Timestamp of the time this record was created

table.name: etl_execution_map
table.remarks: ETL Tool monitoring table to store execution details of batch processing interfaces

column.name: interface_id
column.remarks: Unique interface name to represent a batch execution. Part of the composite PK, with execution_id column.

column.name: execution_id
column.remarks: Execution ID number to represent a instance of interface_id. Part of the composite PK, with interface_id column.

column.name: execution_parent_id
column.remarks: Reference to a parent execution ID that groups one or more execution_id in a batch run. If null, then this execution_id is a parent.

column.name: execution_order
column.remarks: Order of execution of this instance in a collection of same execution_parent_id. Execution runs in ascending order. If it is less than 0, it will not run.

column.name: source_file
column.remarks: Source instruction file for batch execution

column.name: source_db_type
column.remarks: Database type of the source connection. Expected ORACLE or POSTGRES.

column.name: source_name
column.remarks: Source name of this batch execution

column.name: source_table
column.remarks: Source table (if it is a single table) of this batch execution

column.name: target_file
column.remarks: Target instruction file for batch execution

column.name: target_db_type
column.remarks: Database type of the target connection. Expected ORACLE or POSTGRES.

column.name: target_name
column.remarks: Target name of this batch execution

column.name: target_table
column.remarks: Target table (if it is a single table) of this batch execution

column.name: target_primary_key
column.remarks: Primary key of the target table of this batch execution

column.name: truncate_before_run
column.remarks: If the target table should be truncated before the batch execution

column.name: retry_errors
column.remarks: If true, this process will execute again old instances with errors in ETL_EXECUTION_LOG_HIST

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp of the last time this record was updated

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Timestamp of the time this record was created

table.name: etl_execution_schedule
table.remarks: ETL Tool schedule table to define what delta time should be used in the next execution

column.name: interface_id
column.remarks: Unique interface name to represent a batch execution. Refer to EXECUTION_MAP table PK

column.name: execution_id
column.remarks: The execution ID that represent a batch execution. Refer to EXECUTION_MAP table PK

column.name: last_run_ts
column.remarks: Last timestamp this interface/execution_id was executed for batch execution

column.name: current_run_ts
column.remarks: Current timestamp this interface was executed of this batch execution. It will be the next last_run_ts for this execution.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp of the last time this record was updated

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Timestamp of the time this record was created

table.name: gametic_methodology_list
table.remarks: A list of valid codes indicating the methods used in a seed Orchard to estimate the female or male component of gamete contributions to a Seedlot.

column.name: gametic_methodology_code
column.remarks: Code that describes the gametic contribution method code for a seedlot

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description for the affiliated code.

column.name: female_methodology_ind
column.remarks: A flag that indicates if the methodology is female or not.

column.name: pli_species_ind
column.remarks: A flag that indicates if the methodology can be used by a PLI species or not

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The effective date the code is in effect

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the code expires on.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time of the last update.

table.name: genetic_class_list
table.remarks: A list of valid Genetic Class Codes that indicate if a lot is collected from Parent Trees in an Orchard or from a natural stand.

column.name: genetic_class_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Genetic Classes.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description for the affiliated code.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The effective date the code is in effect

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the code expires on.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time of the last update.

table.name: genetic_worth_list
table.remarks: A list of valid codes that describe the genetic trait(s) of Parent Trees, Seedlots and Vegetative Lots.

column.name: genetic_worth_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Genetic Worths.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description for the affiliated code.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The effective date the code is in effect

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the code expires on.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time of the last update.

table.name: method_of_payment_list
table.remarks: A list of valid Method of Payment Codes.

column.name: method_of_payment_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Method of Payments.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description for the affiliated code.

column.name: default_method_ind
column.remarks: A flag that determines if the method is default.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The effective date the code is in effect.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the code expires on.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time of the last update.

table.name: seedlot
table.remarks: A quantity of seed of a particular species and quality collected from either a natural stand or seed Orchard in a given time period.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: seedlot_status_code
column.remarks: A code which represents the current status of a lot.

column.name: applicant_client_number
column.remarks: A sequentially assigned number which uniquely identifies a Ministry client (applicant).

column.name: applicant_locn_code
column.remarks: A code to uniquely identify, within each client (applicant), the addresses of different divisions or locations at which the client operates. The location code is sequentially assigned starting with "00" for the client´s permanent address.

column.name: applicant_email_address
column.remarks: Email address of client applying to register the Seedlot

column.name: vegetation_code
column.remarks: A code which represents a species of tree or brush.

column.name: genetic_class_code
column.remarks: A code which represents the Genetic Quality of material (seed or cuttings). "A" class represents superior Orchard produced seed or cuttings. "B" class represents naturally collected seed or cuttings.

column.name: seedlot_source_code
column.remarks: A code to indicate if an Orchard Seedlot is from tested Parent Trees, untested or custom.

column.name: to_be_registrd_ind
column.remarks: An indicator which represents whether a Seedlot is intended to be registered for crown land reforestation use ("Y" yes) or not ("N" no).

column.name: bc_source_ind
column.remarks: Indicates whether the source of the Seedlot is within British Columbia

column.name: collection_client_number
column.remarks: A sequentially assigned number which uniquely identifies a Ministry client (collection).

column.name: collection_locn_code
column.remarks: A code to uniquely identify, within each client (collection), the addresses of different divisions or locations at which the client operates. The location code is sequentially assigned starting with "00" for the client´s permanent address.

column.name: collection_start_date
column.remarks: The actual start date (year, month, and day) that the cones (source for seedlots) were collected.

column.name: collection_end_date
column.remarks: The actual end date (year, month, and day) that the cones (source for seedlots) were collected.

column.name: no_of_containers
column.remarks: The number of containers (sacks of cones) that were collected.

column.name: vol_per_container
column.remarks: The volume of cones, in hectolitres, that were collected per container (as reported on the cone collection form).

column.name: clctn_volume
column.remarks: A code which represents the number of trees that the Seedlot was collected from.

column.name: seedlot_comment
column.remarks: A free format text field used to enter general comments for a Seedlot.

column.name: interm_strg_client_number
column.remarks: A sequentially assigned number which uniquely identifies a Ministry client (interm storage).

column.name: interm_strg_locn_code
column.remarks: A code to uniquely identify, within each client (interm storage), the addresses of different divisions or locations at which the client operates. The location code is sequentially assigned starting with "00" for the client´s permanent address.

column.name: interm_strg_st_date
column.remarks: The actual start date (year, month, and day) when the cone was stored during interim storage.

column.name: interm_strg_end_date
column.remarks: The actual end date (year, month, and day) when the cone was stored during interim storage.

column.name: interm_facility_code
column.remarks: A code which represents the type of facility where the seed was stored during interim storage.

column.name: female_gametic_mthd_code
column.remarks: Code that describes the female gametic contribution method code for a Seedlot.

column.name: male_gametic_mthd_code
column.remarks: Code that describes the male gametic contribution method code for a Seedlot.

column.name: controlled_cross_ind
column.remarks: Indicates whether the lot was produced through controlled crosses.

column.name: biotech_processes_ind
column.remarks: Indicates if biotechnological processes been used to produce this lot.

column.name: pollen_contamination_ind
column.remarks: Indicates if pollen contamination was present in the seed Orchard

column.name: pollen_contamination_pct
column.remarks: The proportion of contaminant pollen present in the seed Orchard.

column.name: contaminant_pollen_bv
column.remarks: The estimated Breeding Value of the contaminant pollen in an Orchard.

column.name: pollen_contamination_mthd_code
column.remarks: Code that describes the pollen contamination method.

column.name: total_parent_trees
column.remarks: The total number of parents contributing to the Seedlot.

column.name: smp_success_pct
column.remarks: The estimated success (percent) of the supplemental mass pollination mix on the Parent Trees in the Orchard.

column.name: effective_pop_size
column.remarks: The calculated number of parents contributing to the Seedlot, representing the genetic variety.

column.name: smp_parents_outside
column.remarks: The number of Parent Trees from outside an Orchard used in the supplemental mass pollination mix.

column.name: non_orchard_pollen_contam_pct
column.remarks: Non-orchard pollen contamination (%) for the Seedlot.

column.name: extractory_client_number
column.remarks: A sequentially assigned number which uniquely identifies a Ministry client (extractory).

column.name: extractory_locn_code
column.remarks: A code to uniquely identify, within each client (extractory), the addresses of different divisions or locations at which the client operates. The location code is sequentially assigned starting with "00" for the client´s permanent address.

column.name: extraction_st_date
column.remarks: The actual start date (year, month, and day) when the seed was extracted from the cones.

column.name: extraction_end_date
column.remarks: The actual end date (year, month, and day) when the seed was extracted from the cones.

column.name: temporary_strg_client_number
column.remarks: A sequentially assigned number which uniquely identifies a Ministry client (storage).

column.name: temporary_strg_locn_code
column.remarks: A code to uniquely identify, within each client (storage), the addresses of different divisions or locations at which the client operates. The location code is sequentially assigned starting with "00" for the client´s permanent address.

column.name: temporary_strg_start_date
column.remarks: Commencement date of temporary Seedlot storage.

column.name: temporary_strg_end_date
column.remarks: End date of Seedlot temporary storage.

column.name: declared_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that declares the following: - that the information is true and correct - that they are the owner of the lot or are authorized by the owner(s) to submit the Seedlot application.

column.name: declared_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time that the following were declared by the declarer: - that the information is true and correct - that they are the owner of the lot or are authorized by the owner(s) to submit the Seedlot application.

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Seedlot.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Seedlot.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

column.name: interm_strg_locn
column.remarks: The location where the tree seed was stored during interim storage. Can be used if users did not enter a registered client data.

column.name: seed_plan_unit_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier which is assigned to a Seed Planning Unit.

column.name: bgc_zone_code
column.remarks: The Biogeoclimatic Zone of the Seedlot collection area.

column.name: bgc_subzone_code
column.remarks: The Biogeoclimatic Subzone of the Seedlot collection area.

column.name: variant
column.remarks: A division of biogeoclimatic information, with multiple variants in a BGC Subzone.

column.name: bec_version_id
column.remarks: A sequence generated identifier for each BEC version.

column.name: elevation
column.remarks: The representative elevation in meters where the seed lot originated, which is also the mean area of use elevation for natural stand lots. For orchard seed lots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source elevations.

column.name: latitude_degrees
column.remarks: The representative latitude (degrees) where the seed lot originated, which is also the mean area of use latitude for natural stand lots. For orchard seed lots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source latitudes.

column.name: latitude_minutes
column.remarks: The representative latitude (minutes) where the seed lot originated, which is also the mean area of use latitude for natural stand lots. For orchard seed lots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source latitudes.

column.name: latitude_seconds
column.remarks: The representative latitude (seconds) where the seed lot originated, which is also the mean area of use latitude for natural stand lots. For orchard seed lots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source latitudes.

column.name: longitude_degrees
column.remarks: The representative longitude (degrees) where the seed lot originated, which is also the mean area of use longitude for natural stand lots. For orchard seed lots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source longitudes.

column.name: longitude_minutes
column.remarks: The representative longitude (minutes) where the seed lot originated, which is also the mean area of use longitude for natural stand lots. For orchard seed lots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source longitudes.

column.name: longitude_seconds
column.remarks: The representative longitude (seconds) where the seed lot originated, which is also the mean area of use longitude for natural stand lots. For orchard seed lots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source longitudes.

column.name: collection_elevation
column.remarks: The representative elevation in meters of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source elevations.

column.name: collection_elevation_min
column.remarks: The representative minimum elevation in meters of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source elevations.

column.name: collection_elevation_max
column.remarks: The representative maximum elevation in meters of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source elevations.

column.name: collection_latitude_deg
column.remarks: The representative latitude (degrees) of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source latitude.

column.name: collection_latitude_min
column.remarks: The representative latitude (minutes) of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source latitude.

column.name: collection_latitude_sec
column.remarks: The representative latitude (seconds) of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source latitude.

column.name: collection_latitude_code
column.remarks: A code which specifies whether the exotic origin latitude is north (N) or south (S).

column.name: collection_longitude_deg
column.remarks: The representative longitude (degrees) of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source longitude.

column.name: collection_longitude_min
column.remarks: The representative longitude (minutes) of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source longitude.

column.name: collection_longitude_sec
column.remarks: The representative longitude (seconds) of the Seedlot collection area. For orchard seedlots it is a weighted average of the contributing parent trees source longitude.

column.name: collection_longitude_code
column.remarks: A code which specifies whether the exotic origin longitude is east (E) or west (W).

column.name: elevation_min
column.remarks: The minimum elevation of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: elevation_max
column.remarks: The maximum elevation of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: latitude_deg_min
column.remarks: The minimum latitude (degrees) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: latitude_min_min
column.remarks: The minimum latitude (minutes) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: latitude_sec_min
column.remarks: The minimum latitude (seconds) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: latitude_deg_max
column.remarks: The maximum latitude (degrees) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: latitude_min_max
column.remarks: The maximum latitude (minutes) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: latitude_sec_max
column.remarks: The maximum latitude (seconds) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: longitude_deg_min
column.remarks: The minimum longitude (degrees) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: longitude_min_min
column.remarks: The minimum longitude (minutes) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: longitude_sec_min
column.remarks: The minimum longitude (seconds) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: longitude_deg_max
column.remarks: The maximum longitude (degrees) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: longitude_min_max
column.remarks: The maximum longitude (minutes) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: longitude_sec_max
column.remarks: The maximum longitude (seconds) of the seedlot area of use. For lots from natural stands, this is calculated using the transfer limits. For lots from tested parent trees (orchards) either use Seed Planning Unit minimum or the collection latitude.

column.name: smp_mean_bv_growth
column.remarks: The breeding value for the Growth trait calculated from the supplemental mass pollination mix applied to parent trees.

column.name: area_of_use_comment
column.remarks: Comments on Seedlot area of use.

column.name: mean_geom
column.remarks: The 3D mean geom of parent trees.

column.name: bgc_zone_description
column.remarks: The description of the BEC zone.

column.name: seedlot_audit_id
column.remarks: Serial Incremental number referring to a unique primary key for this table

column.name: audit_date
column.remarks: Date when this audit record was created (representing with some precision when the statement was executed)

column.name: spar_audit_code
column.remarks: Type of statement executed in spar.seedlot table: I=INSERT, U=UPDATE, D=DELETE. Note that DELETE record represents only the latest data whiped out from the seedlot table

column.name: db_user
column.remarks: Postgres database user who executed the statement in spar.seedlot table

column.name: audit_revision_version
column.remarks: Record registered version for audit purposes.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.seedlot_number column

column.name: seedlot_status_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.seedlot_status_code column

column.name: applicant_client_number
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.applicant_client_number column

column.name: applicant_locn_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.applicant_locn_code column

column.name: applicant_email_address
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.applicant_email_address column

column.name: vegetation_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.vegetation_code column

column.name: genetic_class_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.genetic_class_code column

column.name: seedlot_source_code

column.name: to_be_registrd_ind
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.to_be_registrd_ind column

column.name: bc_source_ind
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.bc_source_ind column

column.name: collection_client_number
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.collection_client_number column

column.name: collection_locn_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.collection_locn_code column

column.name: collection_start_date
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.collection_start_date column

column.name: collection_end_date
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.collection_end_date column

column.name: no_of_containers
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.no_of_containers column

column.name: vol_per_container
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.vol_per_container column

column.name: clctn_volume
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.clctn_volume column

column.name: seedlot_comment
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.seedlot_comment column

column.name: interm_strg_client_number
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.interm_strg_client_number column

column.name: interm_strg_locn_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.interm_strg_locn_code column

column.name: interm_strg_st_date
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.interm_strg_st_date column

column.name: interm_strg_end_date
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.interm_strg_end_date column

column.name: interm_facility_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.interm_facility_code column

column.name: female_gametic_mthd_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.female_gametic_mthd_code column

column.name: male_gametic_mthd_code
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.male_gametic_mthd_code column

column.name: controlled_cross_ind
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.controlled_cross_ind column

column.name: biotech_processes_ind
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.biotech_processes_ind column

column.name: pollen_contamination_ind
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.pollen_contamination_ind column

column.name: pollen_contamination_pct
column.remarks: Referring value for spar.seedlot.pollen_contamination_pct column

column.name: contaminant_pollen_bv

table.name: seedlot_collection_method
table.remarks: The collection methods in which the cones of a Seedlot were collected.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: cone_collection_method_code
column.remarks: A code representing the method in which the cones were collected.

column.name: cone_collection_method_other_desc
column.remarks: A description of the method in which the cones were collected - used only when the user selects the option "Other".

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Seedlot collection method.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot collection method was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Seedlot collection method.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot collection method was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

table.name: seedlot_genetic_worth
table.remarks: A subclassification of Genetic Quality for "A" class Seedlots.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: genetic_worth_code
column.remarks: A code which represents a subclassification of Genetic Quality for "A" class seedlots.

column.name: genetic_quality_value
column.remarks: The rating for a subclassification of Genetic Quality for "A" class seedlots.

column.name: tested_parent_tree_cont_pct
column.remarks: Percentage of parent trees that were tested for the trait and contributed to the seedlot

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Seedlot Genetic Worth.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot Genetic Worth was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Seedlot Genetic Worth.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot Genetic Worth was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

table.name: seedlot_orchard
table.remarks: Orchard location where cuttings or A class seed is produced.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: orchard_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier which is assigned to a location where cuttings or A class seed is produced.

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Seedlot Orchard.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot Orchard was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Seedlot Orchard.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot Orchard was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

table.name: seedlot_owner_quantity
table.remarks: A Seedlot may be owned by more than one owner. Each owner owns a specific quantity of seed which may be reserved for the use of that owner and/or surplus and available for use by others.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: owner_client_number
column.remarks: A sequentially assigned number which uniquely identifies a Ministry client (owner).

column.name: owner_locn_code
column.remarks: A code to uniquely identify, within each client (owner), the addresses of different divisions or locations at which the client operates. The location code is sequentially assigned starting with "00" for the client´s permanent address.

column.name: original_pct_owned
column.remarks: The original percentage of seed that was owned by a client.

column.name: original_pct_rsrvd
column.remarks: The original percentage of seed from an owner´s portion of a Seedlot that has been declared reserved.

column.name: original_pct_srpls
column.remarks: The original percentage of seed from an owner´s portion of a Seedlot that has been declared surplus.

column.name: method_of_payment_code
column.remarks: A code which represents the method of payment for services where payment is required.

column.name: spar_fund_srce_code
column.remarks: A code which represents the source funds for payment of the request.

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Seedlot owner quantity.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot owner quantity was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Seedlot owner quantity.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot owner quantity was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

table.name: seedlot_parent_tree
table.remarks: The contribution of Parent Trees (with their cone and pollen quantity of each Parent Tree) to an Orchard Seedlot (Genetic Class = "A")

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: parent_tree_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Parent Tree.

column.name: parent_tree_number
column.remarks: The original registration number given to a Parent Tree in conjunction with a Species Code.

column.name: cone_count
column.remarks: The number of cones counted or estimated from each Parent Tree for a Seedlot.

column.name: pollen_count
column.remarks: The amount of pollen counted or estimated for each Parent Tree in the Seedlot.

column.name: smp_success_pct
column.remarks: The estimated success (percent) of the supplemental mass pollination mix on the Parent Trees in the Orchard.

column.name: non_orchard_pollen_contam_pct
column.remarks: Non-orchard pollen contamination (%).

column.name: total_genetic_worth_contrib
column.remarks: Total Parent (seed) genetic worth contribution to seedlot

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Seedlot Parent Tree.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot Parent Tree was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Seedlot Parent Tree.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot Parent Tree was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

table.name: seedlot_parent_tree_gen_qlty
table.remarks: The Genetic Worth value(s) for an Orchard Seedlot (Genetic Class = "A") calculated from the Genetic Quality (Breeding Values) of the Parent Trees contributing to the Seedlot.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: parent_tree_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Parent Tree.

column.name: genetic_type_code
column.remarks: Describes the comparative measure of genetic value for a specific genetic trait of a Parent Tree. Examples are BV (Breeding Value) and CV (Clonal Value).

column.name: genetic_worth_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Genetic Worths.

column.name: genetic_quality_value
column.remarks: The Genetic Quality value based on the test assessment for a Parent Tree from a test no. and series.

column.name: estimated_ind
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not the test result was estimated. A Genetic Quality value of 2.0 is estimated for Untested Parent Trees (i.e. Parent Trees without an Area of Use) or for Tested Parent Trees (i.e. Parent Trees with an Area of Use) without a Genetic.

column.name: untested_ind
column.remarks: Indicates whether or not the test result was estimated for an untested Parent Tree.

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Seedlot Parent Tree Genetic Quality.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot Parent Tree Genetic Quality was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Seedlot Parent Tree Genetic Quality.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot Parent Tree Genetic Quality was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

table.name: seedlot_parent_tree_smp_mix
table.remarks: Supplemental Mass Polination for a given Seedlot, Parent Tree, Genetic Type and Genetic worth combination.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: parent_tree_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Parent Tree.

column.name: genetic_type_code
column.remarks: Describes the comparative measure of genetic value for a specific genetic trait of a Parent Tree. Examples are BV (Breeding Value) and CV (Clonal Value).

column.name: genetic_worth_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Genetic Worths.

column.name: genetic_quality_value
column.remarks: The Genetic Quality value based on the test assessment for a Parent Tree from a test no. and series.

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Parent Tree SMP mix

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Parent Tree SMP mix was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Parent Tree SMP mix.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Parent Tree SMP mix was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: seed_plan_zone_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Seed Planning Zones.

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the Seedlot collection method.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot collection method was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the Seedlot collection method.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a Seedlot collection method was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

column.name: seed_plan_zone_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for a combination of Seed Plan Zone Code, Genetic Class and Vegetation Code

column.name: genetic_class_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Genetic Classes.

table.name: seedlot_source_list
table.remarks: A list of valid Lot Source Codes.

column.name: seedlot_source_code
column.remarks: A code to indicate if an orchard seedlot is from tested parent trees, untested or custom.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description for the affiliated code.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The effective date the code is in effect

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the code expires on.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time of the last update.

table.name: seedlot_status_list
table.remarks: A list of valid Seedlot based Status Codes.

column.name: seedlot_status_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Seedlot Statuses.

column.name: description
column.remarks: A description for the affiliated code.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The effective date the code is in effect

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date the code expires on.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time of the last update.

table.name: smp_mix
table.remarks: A table listing the individual Parent Trees that contributed to the Supplemental Mass Pollination mix of an Orchard Seedlot (Genetic Class = "A").

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: parent_tree_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Parent Tree.

column.name: parent_tree_number
column.remarks: The original registration number given to a Parent Tree in conjunction with a Species Code.

column.name: amount_of_material
column.remarks: The amount of Parent Tree material used for calculating the proportion of mix. Usually a volume recorded in mL.

column.name: proportion
column.remarks: The proportion of each Parent Tree material used for calculating SMP mix.

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the SMP mix.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a SMP mix was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the SMP mix.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a SMP mix was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

table.name: smp_mix_gen_qlty
table.remarks: The calculated Genetic Worth value(s) for the Supplemental Mass Pollination mix that contributed to an Orchard Seedlot (Genetic Class = "A") the Parent Trees contributing to a Seedlot.

column.name: seedlot_number
column.remarks: The unique number (key) assigned to a quantity of seed of a particular species and quality from a given location collected at a given time.

column.name: parent_tree_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier for each Parent Tree.

column.name: genetic_type_code
column.remarks: Describes the comparative measure of genetic value for a specific genetic trait of a Parent Tree. Examples are BV (Breeding Value) and CV (Clonal Value).

column.name: genetic_worth_code
column.remarks: A code describing various Genetic Worths.

column.name: genetic_quality_value
column.remarks: The Genetic Quality value based on the test assessment for a Parent Tree from a test no. and series.

column.name: entry_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that entered the SMP mix Genetic Quality.

column.name: entry_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a SMP mix Genetic Quality was entered onto the system.

column.name: update_userid
column.remarks: The userid of the individual that changed the SMP mix Genetic Quality.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The time and date a SMP mix Genetic Quality was last updated on the system.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A counter used to ensure data integrity. This item should be incremented during each update.

routine.name: seedlot_if_modified_func()
